1. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
2. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

4. Regulatory signs are:

6. To enter a freeway:
column4: signal and enter the freeway. You have the right-of-way.
column6: make a complete stop before entering the freeway.
column8: drive slowly so you can check traffic.
column10: signal, yield, and enter at the same speed that traffic is moving.

column2: 7. This sign tells drivers that:
column8: they must stop at the next intersection.
column10: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 8. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column6: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column8: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.

column2: 9. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
10. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column8: Do not drive if you are very weary.

column2: 11. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

13. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
14. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column6: enter one of the blind spots and wait.

column2: 15. The picture shows a _________ sign.
16. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column6: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column8: A road joins from the right

column2: 18. This traffic sign warns you about:
column6: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 19. Which shape is a warning sign?
20. A driver should be extra alert for motorcyclists, bicycles and pedestrians. Why?
column10: They are hard to see in traffic.

column2: 21. ABS is the acronym for:
22. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column6: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column8: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.

column2: 23. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column8: remove yourself before it starts to sink.

column2: 24. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: you may stop to let out passengers.
column6: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.
column8: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column10: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 26. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
27. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
28. When entering an expressway behind several other vehicles, what is most important?
column4: Stay as close as possible to the vehicle in front of you.
column8: Keep your eyes on the vehicle behind you.
column10: Adjust the position and speed of your vehicle to  the flow of traffic.

41. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.
column6: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

column2: 42. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: maintain focus toward the left of the road.
column6: stare straight ahead at all times.
column8: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column10: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.

column2: 43. This road sign means:
44. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column6: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.

column2: 45. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
46. Bicyclists must:
column4: ride in a bicycle lane, if available.
column6: remain near the left edge of the road.
column8: remain to the right when they prepare for a left turn.
column10: travel with more than two side-by-side in a single lane, if possible.

column2: 47. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column8: slow down or move over safely.

column2: 48. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column10: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 49. This sign indicates:
column4: the entrance to a dead-end street.
column6: that you must not drive past this sign.
column8: that you must yield the right-of-way.
column10: the entrance to a construction site.

column2: 50. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
